result.execSummary:
The defendant William Neal Ledford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Neal Ledford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Neal Ledford was found guilty of Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • William Neal Ledford was found guilty of Armed Robbery, Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Trempealeau County Case No. 09CF64.  Waupun Correctional Institution as Reception Center.  No more than 20% of prison wages to be assigned to restitution payment.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with W.H. or J.H. or their residence.
Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.
Restitution ordered: $10,000 - J.H.  No more than 20% of prison wages to be assigned to restitution payment.

John Sacia appears for the State.  Taavi McMahon appears by phone.  Defendant appears in custody by video.  Defense Attorney Andrew Martinez appears by phone.  Def KVI waives right to appear in person.  Court finds def KVI waives right to appear in person.  Def requests defense attorney be withdrawn and requests to represent himself.  No objection by Attorney Martinez.  Court grants request and finds def KVI waives right to have an attorney and def may represent himself.  Attorney Martinez to prepare order for withdraw.  PTC and PLEAH set.  Bond cont.
